title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Tuesday, 1 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: disruption to operations at cambridgeshire 's hospitals despite a 24-hour strike by junior doctors being called off .
secondary schools in cambridgeshire are ranked among the worst performing in england .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: that 's all from local live for today
text: that 's all from the cambridgeshire live team for today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county .
if you have something to share with us , you can send us your stories and
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mainly cloudy and dry overnight
text: it will be dry and cloudy overnight .
temperatures will be very mild for the time of year .
minimum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow is expected to be dry through much of the day , with brighter spells developing in places .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: father of baby believed to be youngest organ donor praises hospital staff
text: the father of a newborn who lived just 74 minutes has praised staff who looked after her at the rosie hospital in cambridge .
hope lee is believed to be the uk 's youngest organ donor after her parents gave their blessing , as reported in the cambridge news .
drew lee , from newmarket , says the support the family received has been `` unbelievable '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: steve barclay : 'no more important vote ' than deciding to commit military forces
text: `` there is no more important vote in parliament than deciding whether to commit military forces , '' says north east cambridgeshire mp steve barclay , who is voting for uk air strikes in syria to try and defeat so-called islamic state .

the conservative mp , who served in the forces before being elected , said : `` given the lack of a clear border between iraq and syria , it is important to consider whether this existing action should extend to include syria '' .
conservative south east cambs mp , lucy frazer , says she will also vote for air strikes .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: 'youngest ' donor 'achieved so much ' says father
text: the father of a baby believed to be the uk 's youngest organ donor says she `` achieved so much '' in her short life .
as reported by the cambridge news , drew and emma lee 's baby daughter , hope , suffered from a rare condition which meant she lived just 74 minutes , at the rosie hospital in cambridge .
drew lee says a woman who had received hope 's kidneys was doing well , and that liver cells taken `` with the family 's blessing '' would be used in research .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : school principal blames funding for cambridgeshire secondary school problems man left with serious injuries after a14 crash
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: father of 'youngest ' organ donor says he had no doubts
text: the father of a newborn baby girl believed to be the uk 's youngest organ donor says he never had any doubts about donating her organs .
as reported in the cambridge news , hope lee ( above left ) lived for just 74 minutes after being born at cambridge 's rosie maternity hospital last week .
drew lee says donating her kidneys and liver cells meant hope had `` achieved so much '' in her short life .
her twin brother josh is now back at the family home in newmarket .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: syria vote : cambridge mp says he will not support military action
text: cambridge 's labour mp , daniel zeichner , has tweeted to say he will be voting against uk air strikes on syria .
we need to ensure our security and that of the syrian people .
bombing wo n't achieve that security , so i 'll be voting against air strikes .
@ twitterid appreciate your busy , but your constituents might appreciate a small blog post ( or similar ) explaining your descision .
@ twitterid there 's a little more here
@ twitterid very disappointed .
unless we act with our allies is will win .
@ twitterid i agree , but air-strikes would have to be complementary to a long term strategy to stabilise syria and no evidence there is
@ twitterid disappointed in your vote on daesh .
mrs davies
@ twitterid @ twitterid thank you
@ twitterid @ twitterid we just need the rest of the party to realise .
thank you daniel
@ twitterid well done daniel
@ twitterid @ twitterid pls clarify what actions you feel are appropriate and if you have a plan of action to carry them out .
oil etc .
@ twitterid @ twitterid good for you , let 's hope more mp 's see sense .
@ twitterid thank you
@ twitterid 10 points to my mp
@ twitterid i 'm glad to hear that .
@ twitterid thank you daniel .
good call after good call .
@ twitterid thank you
@ twitterid thank you for representing my view by voting against bombing syria
@ twitterid i 'm glad you take this position .
@ twitterid excellent work , please keep up the opposition to syrian bombing .
thank you
@ twitterid delighted to hear that you will be voting against bombing in syria .
trying to remain hopeful about the outcome tonight .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: school principal blames funding and staff recruitment on county 's problems
text: i 've spoken to andrew goulding , principal at hinchingbrooke school , about cambridgeshire being ranked in the bottom 10 authorities for secondary schools rated good or outstanding by ofsted .
the huntingdon school is currently classed as `` requiring improvement '' , but it 's due another inspection soon .
mr goulding blamed reasons such as historically low funding , staff recruitment and retention , plus a relaxed pupil culture as contributory factors to the problems the county faces .
author: Anna Todd
BBC Look East

documents.title: a14 lorry crash update : man in 30s taken to hospital with 'serious leg injuries '
text: the ambulance service has told us a man in his 30s has been taken to addenbrooke 's hospital , in cambridge , with `` serious leg injuries , '' following a crash between two lorries .
emergency services were called to the m11 junction with the a14 at girton just before 14:00 .
drivers can expect long delays .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: one person has 'life-threatening ' injuries following a14 girton crash
text: police have just told us one person is believed to have `` life-threatening '' injuries following a crash between two lorries on the a14 at girton .
if we hear any more we 'll let you know .
travel has the latest closure information .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: man trapped in vehicle after crash on a14 at girton
text: the ambulance service says a man is trapped following a crash between two lorries on the a14 at girton .
the east anglian air ambulance is also in attendance .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: a14 shut westbound near girton
text: the a14 has been shut westbound between junctions 31 and 30 near girton , on the outskirts of cambridge , because of a serious accident .
congestion is going back on the m11 to junction 13 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: no operations cancelled at hinchingbrooke hospital due to planned junior doctors strike
text: hinchingbrooke hospital has told us no operations were cancelled because of the planned strike by junior doctors .

the british medical association agreed to suspend the walk-out following a last-minute breakthrough in talks , but across the uk about 4,000 patients have had treatment delayed - including a number in peterborough .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more peterborough children going to good or outstanding rated schools
text: more children in peterborough are going to good and outstanding schools than ever before , new figures show .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: uk should 'play part ' in syria , says huntingdon mp jonathan djanogly
text: huntingdon mp jonathan djanogly believes the uk has a `` part to play '' in military action in syria , confirming he will be voting for air strikes in the country .

the conservative mp said : `` having weighed up the pros and cons , of which there are a number of both , i now think that it is right that britain accepts a part to play in taking military action against daesh . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: syria vote : two cambridgeshire mps say they will support airstrikes
text: cambridgeshire conservative mps heidi allen ( below ) and stewart jackson have confirmed they will be voting in favour of air strikes in syria .
the prime minister is asking his cabinet to endorse a one-day commons debate and vote on wednesday over uk air strikes against so-called islamic state .
for the latest on the syria vote , head to politics live .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: incident near guided busway crossing in st ives
text: there are reports of an incident near the guided busway crossing in harrison 's way , st ives .
drivers are told to expect delays .
# a1096 harrison way # stives near the junction with the busway crossing .
incident .
delays in both directions
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : cambridgeshire secondary schools among worst performing in england dog badly injured after being 'dragged or thrown from moving car '
text: if you 're just joining us here are the headlines this afternoon :
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : a dry afternoon with some sunny spells
text: it will be mostly dry and cloudy , although a few bright or sunny intervals are possible .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: performance of cambridgeshire secondary schools should be 'national concern '
text: ofsted chief sir michael wilshaw has called for greater `` political will '' to improve the quality of teaching , as cambridgeshire 's secondary schools are named as some of the worst performing in england .
the chief inspector of schools says the `` mediocrity in secondary performance should be a national concern '' .
cambridgeshire is among the bottom 10 authorities for secondary schools rated good or outstanding .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough school shut as possible power cut is investigated
text: a potential power cut in peterborough is being investigated after a city school said it was closing for the day due to a lack of power .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: operations cancelled : have you been affected ?
text: hospitals in the county still cancelled operations today despite a 24-hour strike by junior doctors being called off .
nationally more than 4,000 patients have already had their treatment delayed .
have you been affected ?
if so , tell us your story via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridgeshire pupils in good or outstanding secondary schools down 10 %
text: the number of pupils in good or outstanding secondary schools in cambridgeshire has decreased by 10 % in a year , according to ofsted .
the education watchdog 's annual report says just 45 % of secondary pupils went to schools deemed good or outstanding in 2015 .
cambridgeshire is among the bottom 10 local authorities in england .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : cambridgeshire secondary schools among worst performing in england dog badly injured after being 'dragged or thrown from moving car '
text: here are the main stories in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: safety warning to cambridge students after assault by 'hammer-wielding thugs '
text: students have been warned not to walk home alone on fen causeway in cambridge , after a man was attacked by hammer-wielding thugs .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: dog badly injured after being 'thrown from moving car ' in peterborough
text: a dog suffered `` shocking wounds '' after being dragged behind or thrown from a moving car in peterborough , the rspca said .
the tan-coloured crossbreed was found by officers roaming eastfield road in the city .
the charity has appealed for anyone with information to get in touch .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridgeshire christmas 'tree bank ' opens to 'help spread cheer '
text: a mum who started a christmas `` tree bank '' three years ago for people who ca n't afford one says it is going from strength-to-strength - and she already has a garage full of donated decorations .
four years ago hayley dolbear from march could not afford a tree so a neighbour gave one to her .
this inspired her to appeal for unwanted trees to `` help spread cheer to those in need '' .
author: Katharine Park
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: junior doctor strike off after appointments cancelled at peterborough city hospital
text: a national strike of junior doctors has been called off at the last minute , but only after 120 patients at peterborough city hospital had their appointments cancelled .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: cambridgeshire secondary schools among worst performing in england
text: cambridgeshire has one of the lowest proportions of outstanding and good secondary schools in england , according to ofsted 's annual report .
the education watchdog says cambridgeshire is among the bottom 10 local authorities , with 45.3 % of secondary schools rated outstanding or good .
ofsted chief sir michael wilshaw says more attention must be focused on regions where too many schools are `` languishing in mediocrity '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: newborn baby girl hope lee becomes uk 's youngest organ donor
text: a newborn baby girl has become the uk 's youngest organ donor after she tragically passed away less than three hours old .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: operations cancelled at cambridgeshire hospitals despite junior doctors ' strike being called off
text: operations have been disrupted and cancelled at cambridgeshire 's hospitals , despite a 24-hour strike by junior doctors being called off .
the british medical association agreed to suspend the walk-out following a last-minute breakthrough in talks .
peterborough and stamford hospitals nhs foundation trust told bbc radio cambridgeshire 120 patients have had appointments cancelled .
we 'll keep you updated with the situation at our other hospitals .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cash-strapped police in cambridge need you to clean their cars and turn detective - for free
text: a cash-strapped police force is recruiting a volunteer `` detective '' to `` find stolen property '' and another to wash its patrol cars at cambridge police station .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: headlines : disruption expected despite junior doctors ' strike being called-off cambridgeshire secondary schools among the worst performing in england
text: here are the headlines in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : delays on m11 southbound at junction 11 following a crash
text: there are delays on the m11 southbound at junction 11 for cambridge following a crash .
for the latest on the the roads , head to bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : outbreaks of rain , becoming drier and milder later
text: there will be outbreaks of light rain at first this morning before it becomes dry and cloudy later .
a few bright or sunny intervals are possible .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's cambridgeshire live page
text: welcome to cambridgeshire live on the first day of december .
we 'll be here until 18:00 with news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county .
if you have something to share with us , you can send us your stories and
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
